short_summary: Dismantling, disposal of furniture, relocation of employees and moving services
description: background information and the objective of the contract.]
full_summary:
### Tender Announcement: Dismantling and Disposal of Furniture and Relocation Services

**Tender Reference:** cb-6131-31184906

**Title:** Dismantling, Disposal of Furniture, and Relocation of Employees and Moving Services for National Accommodation Services

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Publication Date:** June 5, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** June 19, 2023, 14:00:00

**Tender Status:** Expiré (Expired)

### Background

The National Accommodation Services requires the services of a contractor to provide commercial furniture dismantling and disposal, relocation services, and moving services. The contractor must support the activities and projects conducted by Indigenous Services Canada (ISC) and Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada (CIRNAC) in the National Capital Region (NCR).

### Scope of Work

* Dismantle and dispose of commercial furniture for ISC and CIRNAC offices in the NCR
* Relocate employees from different offices in the NCR during the project
* Disconnect, reconnect, and reinstall IT equipment with multiple service providers
* Provide bins and/or boxes for furniture delivery
* Support the mobilization of a contract staff and relocate them during the project

### Performance Requirements

* Deliver the commercial furniture dismantling and disposal services within a three-year period, with options for two-year contract extensions.
* Achieve optimal relocation services within six to eight weeks.
* Meet the needs of the client and fulfill project requirements as outlined in the request for proposal (RFP).

### Eligibility

* Respondents must be able and have experience with commercial furniture dismantling and disposal, relocation services, and moving services.
* The contractor must demonstrate the capacity and resources necessary to fulfill the project requirements outlined in the RFP.

### Additional Requirements

* This bid is subject to the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
* The winner of this contract will have the opportunity to participate in the second phase of the process, should the contract be divided.
* Bidder may organize a site tour as per the procurement strategy detailed in the RFP.

**English:**

The attachments and additional information related to the bid can be found on the following URLs:

https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6131/1000251870_rfp_english.pdf
